intro: Corydalis papilligera, commonly known as the hairy corydalis, is a flowering plant native to regions of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky slopes. Its flowers, which range in color from pale pink to deep purple, bloom in early spring. Corydalis papilligera is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
